snippet: Progress is reported in allowing an oversight board to inspect auditing firms in China whose clients issue securities traded in public markets in the United States.
abstract: Public Company Accounting Oversight Board announces that it will soon be able to oversee auditing firms that certify Chinese companies to be traded on public markets in the United States; agency had been frustrated by a standoff that prevented it from reviewing the audits of Chinese companies that turned out to be frauds. (M)
lead_paragraph: The chairman of the United States regulator that inspects audit firms -- an agency that has been frustrated by its inability to review audits of Chinese companies that turned out to be frauds -- said Tuesday that he expected that his staff would soon be able to sit in on Chinese inspections of auditors. ''We ought to be able to observe the inspections they conduct in the late summer or fall, and certainly by the end of the year,'' said James R. Doty, the chairman of the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board, in an interview after he returned from China. He was a member of the United States delegation at the U.S.-China Strategic and Economic Dialogue.

headline.main: Regulator Predicts U.S. Will Soon Take Part in Chinese Inspections of Auditors
